text: Three strikes and you're out! We had brunch there a few months back, and the meal was so salty that we could barely begin to eat it. That meal was comped and I figured it was an off day. We went back about a month later for dinner, and that meal was also very salty and we could not finish it. We were willing to try again, so we went for dinner tonight. I ordered the filet, and it was like eating a salt shaker. I was shocked that, for a third time, I had a piss poor meal at Casbah. I sent that back, and ordered the sea bass. When I got to the end of the piece of fish, it was raw. Needless to say, I will NEVER return to this restaurant. Looking back, what should I have expected from the sister restaurant of Mad Mex?

The server noticed our dissatisfaction and offered to comp our meal once again, but at this point, we were just tired of the disappointment. We even asked the waiter if they had changed their seasoning or if there was a mistake in the kitchen, but he assured us that everything was prepared as usual. 

Feeling frustrated, we decided to speak with the manager about our recurring issue. He apologized profusely and offered to comp our meal once again. However, we couldn't help but feel that this gesture was simply a band-aid solution to a larger problem. 

As we left the restaurant, we couldn't help but wonder if we would ever return. The consistently salty meals had left a sour taste in our mouths, both literally and figuratively. It was a shame because the ambiance and service were always top-notch. But when it came down to it, the quality of the food was what mattered most. And unfortunately, this restaurant had struck out in that department.

text: I have been in this bar many times with a friend of mine (who has been a patron for decades) and I thought the owners were really nice people but now I wonder. My friend is now confined to a wheelchair and still likes to frequent this bar, however, there are a couple of steps that lead into the back rooms where there are pool tables, dart boards, etc. She cannot get to this area and has a ramp that she would give to the owners so she can access this area. They refuse to put in the ramp. I thought all public businesses had to comply with the Americans With Disabilities Act as long as it does not create an undue hardship. Tell me, how is putting down a ramp that is given to you for free a hardship! SHAME ON YOU CATHY!

It made me question their true intentions and whether they truly cared about their patrons. It's a shame that a place that seemed so welcoming and friendly on the surface could be so dismissive and uncaring towards someone in need.

text: I have been a customer of the Triangle Bar & Grill for over twenty five years. They have the BEST subs ever. BUT on this trip I was buying several to share with people from out of town. They are cash only and more than happy to show you an ATM that charges you $2.50 per transaction. The employees don't set the rules but have to live with them. That $2.50 came out of their tip, they can hit up their boss for the rest. Its 2014 and they still don't take credit and or debit cards. Shame on them.
label: 1 (2 stars)

It was inconvenient to have to go to the ATM and pay the extra fee just to get cash for my order. Additionally, the subs that I usually love seemed to be made with less care this time. The bread was not as fresh and the toppings were not as generous. Overall, it was a disappointing experience and I hope they consider accepting credit cards in the future.

It seemed like a missed opportunity to cater to a wider range of customers. Nevertheless, I was determined to share the deliciousness of their subs with my out-of-town guests.

text: Not exactly a fan of this location, however I tend to frequent it because of my work location, but I always leave unsatisfied. The baristas are not friendly. I'm always always always made to feel like I'm stupid (seriously? i'm ordering coffee from you - who gave you a Masters Degree of all things brewed?) and they're just rude. Just.... rude. I've never had an issue with my order being accurate, although again, just ordering coffee people. I'm not asking you to recite the Gettysburg address.. in Latin.. backwards. Just asking for a coffee.. congrats on getting it right! I wwill also add that everytime I go in to this store, it smells.. bad. real bad. not like the delicious aroma of fresh brewed coffee. No no. You know those febreze commercials where they take the most disgusting atmosphere for smell and throw poor, unsuspecting victims in there to test the febreze-ee-ness of the area? Yeah, it's like that. Only with no febreze. To sum it up, I would suggest if you're in the area and need some starbucks in your life, take a few extra steps and go to the one on the corner of 6th and penn. Those people are SUPER friendly (gave me a free coffee on new years day because I was on my way to work and realized I forgot my credit card after I ordered for me and my coworkers.. so nice!) and it smells like a coffee shop should smell - like coffee. WHOA.. mind. blown.

Additionally, the prices here are quite high compared to other coffee shops in the area. I feel like I'm paying a premium for mediocre service and a subpar experience. Overall, I would not recommend this location to anyone unless they have no other options nearby.

I have to say, this location is not my favorite. The only reason I keep coming back is because it's conveniently close to my workplace. However, I always leave feeling disappointed. The baristas here lack any sense of friendliness. It's as if they have a personal mission to make me feel stupid every time I order a simple cup of coffee. I mean, seriously? Do they think they're the masters of all things brewed? It's just coffee, not rocket science. I don't expect them to recite Shakespeare while making my drink. All I want is a decent cup of coffee, and I must say, they do get that part right. I've never had any issues with the accuracy of my order, but again, it's just coffee. I shouldn't have to applaud them for getting it right. 

One thing that really bothers me about this store is the smell. It's not the delightful aroma of freshly brewed coffee that you would expect. No, it's more like those febreze commercials where they test the product in the most repulsive environments. It's like they purposely create an unpleasant atmosphere. I can't help but wonder if they've ever heard of cleaning or airing out the place. It's a shame because a good coffee shop should have a welcoming and inviting ambiance. Unfortunately, this place falls short in that department.

text: I love the concept but I think it is overrated. I have been hearing so much hype about Primanti Brothers that I was so excited to finally get to stop in at one. I have no problem with the size or amount of grease, I just don't get the greatness of the sandwiches. We ordered the Kolbassi & Cheese and the Pitts-burger cheesesteak (#2 best seller). I had half of each one along with cheese fries. I thought both sandwiches were a little dry especially the cheesesteak. The coleslaw seemed to be too dry for my taste or maybe it was the abundance of fries that dried everything out for me. I am not a big fry fan in the first place. I would like to see some other options for bread like a wheat or whole grain option. I would also recommend putting extra cheese on the sandwich as I couldn't even taste cheese. I like cheese and they need more to help balance the dryness. Service was a little lame as I barely could understand our "too cool" server. He seemed disinterested in us for the most part. The pregnant waitress who helped us out once seemed more congenial and helpful. I like the fact that it is small and fast. I just don't get the vast appeal. I need sauces, fresh ingredients, whole grains, and cheese. I would recommend for everyone to try the place once but I bet there is better options in the Burg.
label: 2 (3 stars)

I have no problem with the size or amount of grease, I just don't get the greatness of the sandwiches. We ordered the Kolbassi & Cheese and the Pitts-burger cheesesteak (#2 best seller). generated_guided_completion: The service was decent, but nothing exceptional. The staff seemed friendly enough, but they didn't go out of their way to make us feel welcome or provide any recommendations. The wait time for our food was reasonable, but it wasn't anything to write home about. Overall, I was just underwhelmed by the whole experience. I had high expectations based on the hype, but unfortunately, it didn't live up to them. I don't think I'll be rushing back to Primanti Brothers anytime soon.
generated_general_completion:
Continuing from the first piece, I also found the service at Primanti Brothers to be quite disappointing. Despite the restaurant being busy, the staff seemed disinterested and inattentive. It took a while for our order to be taken, and even longer for our food to arrive at the table. The lack of efficiency definitely affected my overall experience.

Furthermore, I couldn't help but notice the lack of variety on the menu. While the concept of putting fries and coleslaw in a sandwich is unique, it would be nice to have more options to choose from. Perhaps adding some vegetarian or vegan options would cater to a wider range of customers. Additionally, offering different types of cheese, such as Swiss or provolone, would enhance the flavor profiles of the sandwiches.

In terms of the ambiance, I found the atmosphere to be quite loud and chaotic. The constant noise from the kitchen and the bustling crowd made it difficult to have a conversation without raising our voices. Some soundproofing or background music could greatly improve the dining experience.

Overall, while I appreciate the history and tradition behind Primanti Brothers, I personally feel that it falls short of the hype. The dry sandwiches, lackluster service, limited menu options, and noisy environment all contribute to my underwhelming experience. I believe there is room for improvement in order to truly live up to the reputation that Primanti Brothers has garnered over the years.

text: This location is much better than some of the other downtown Pittsburgh locations, but only because the guy who makes my create your own salads is really really friendly. I love that you can create your own salad; however, for $7.99, I wish the lettuce was always at the peak of freshness. It sometimes is, it sometimes isn't. I like the variety of soups; however, if you want mac and cheese, come early because they always run out of it. The tuscan bean is good, as is the tomato bisque. The roast beef with herbed cheese on a baguette is my favorite sandwich, and this one has never every let me down. Perhaps if the prices were a little lower, I would be more satisfied with the quality of the food.
label: 2 (3 stars)

While they do have a decent selection of soups, it can be disappointing when they run out of mac and cheese, especially if that's what you were looking forward to. Despite these minor drawbacks, this downtown Pittsburgh spot is still a step above the others, thanks to the friendly service and the opportunity to create your own meal.

text: I really like this Saks. It's close to my job so I am in there all the time! Antoine takes care of me with my clothing purchases every time I am there. Tom is my guy for Bond no.9. He sends out postcards telling me about new Bond fragrances and in store Bond events all the time. He always is hooking me up with a free sample when I come in! Reshonda is my girl for all other fragrances. If I want to try something and they don't have a sample she will make me one right on the spot! Now that's service! I would give the store a 5 put the interior SUCKS! It is too small and needs a major updating. It looks like Kaufmann's, Gimbel's or Horne's from back in the 80's. The fragrance counter is too small. The men's section is down in the basement and only half of the floor is men's. The rest is house ware. The majority of the men's section is suits. Can we get some Gucci or Prada clothing not just shoes? They really need to expand or move across the street to the old Lord & Taylor building!
label: 3 (4 stars)

Overall, I would rate the store a solid 5 stars, but I must admit, the interior could use a major update. It feels cramped and outdated, which is a shame considering the outstanding service they provide.

text: Always a good time, although it's definitely not a place I would visit often. It's great for groups....which is quite obvious since there are always several folks there for bachelorette parties and birthdays. Shut out to the piano players, who can not only play the piano, but also sing, play the drums and the sax. They are funny and know how to keep a crowd entertained. Also know some pretty obscure songs. My big criticism is the set up. If you don't have a reservation and/or come later in the evening, it's difficult to get seats. Believe me, I don't mind standing, but it does become a bit awkward when you have to keep scooting over to let waitresses and patrons past you. If you do find a seat, it is often littered with someone else's empty glasses.
label: 3 (4 stars)

The service can also be hit or miss, depending on how busy they are. Sometimes it takes a while to get a drink or place an order. However, the staff is generally friendly and accommodating. The drink menu is extensive, with a wide variety of cocktails and specialty drinks to choose from. The food menu is decent, with typical bar fare like burgers, wings, and nachos. Overall, it's a fun spot to go with friends for a night out, but I wouldn't recommend it for a quiet or intimate gathering.
generated_general_completion: The seating arrangement is quite cramped, making it difficult to move around or even find a comfortable spot to sit. However, the lively atmosphere and energetic performances make up for the lack of space. The piano players are truly talented, showcasing their versatility by effortlessly switching between instruments and entertaining the crowd with their humor. They have an impressive repertoire, including some lesser-known songs that add a unique touch to the experience. Despite the crowded setting, it's always a memorable time at this place, especially for special occasions like bachelorette parties and birthdays. Overall, while the set up could be improved, the incredible performances and lively ambiance make it a worthwhile visit.

text: We just completed our wedding registry at the Homestead location. The customer service was outstanding! One of the employees, Chris, walked around with us to help us pick out exactly what we needed. The wedding registry coordinator, Christina, was also very helpful and accommodating. They treated us as if we were royalty. I would recommend this wedding registry without a doubt!

The Homestead location truly exceeded our expectations, and we highly recommend it to anyone in need of a wedding registry.

text: This place has probably some of the best pastries I've ever encountered. The treats are consistently great to amazing to even mouth watering. The bakery is this quaint little place that is really cute with nice baking decorations and everything. The staff is really friendly and always helpful with making the hard selection. The cupcakes are these cream-stuffed pieces of heaven, and their signature sandwiches are out of this world. Everything else leaves nothing to be desired, and keeps me coming back as frequently as I can find someone to accompany me.
label: 4 (5 stars)

I highly recommend this place for anyone with a sweet tooth or anyone looking for a cozy spot to enjoy some tasty treats.

I couldn't resist trying another pastry from this amazing bakery. As soon as I walked in, the sweet aroma of freshly baked goods enveloped me, making my mouth water in anticipation. The display case was filled with an array of delectable treats, each one more tempting than the last.

The bakery itself had a charming and cozy atmosphere, with vintage baking decorations adorning the walls. It felt like stepping into a nostalgic wonderland of all things sweet and delicious. The staff greeted me with warm smiles and eagerly assisted me in choosing my next indulgence.

After much deliberation, I settled on a beautifully crafted fruit tart. The pastry shell was perfectly flaky, providing a delicate crunch with every bite. The filling was a medley of fresh, juicy fruits that burst with vibrant flavors, creating a harmonious blend of sweetness and tanginess.

As I savored each mouthful, I couldn't help but appreciate the skill and passion that went into creating such a masterpiece. It was evident that the bakers at this place poured their hearts into every creation, resulting in pastries that were not only visually stunning but also incredibly delicious.

I left the bakery with a contented smile on my face, already planning my next visit. This place truly deserves its reputation for serving some of the best pastries in town. Whether you're a pastry connoisseur or simply have a sweet tooth, this bakery is a must-visit destination that will leave you craving for more.
